text.p: (Figures in billions of French francs unless stated)
Attributable group profit 3.2 (up 10.4 pct vs proforma 95)
Credit Local de France (million French francs)
Credit Communal de Belgique (million Belgian francs)

NOTE - Dexia, the Franco-Belgian banking group formed by the merger last year of Credit Local de France and Credit Communal de Belgique, gave the results in a statement. It described the first combined results as "very satisfactory" and said they reflected the group's growth potential. It said the total balance sheet came to 1,100 billion French francs on December 31, 1996. General expenses rose 6.4 percent to 6.5 billion French francs, including costs associated with the merger.
Chairman Pierre Richard said in the statement the group's objective was a gradual increase in return on equity which currently stood at 11.5 percent.

Dexia, defining itself as a banking group with multiple specialities in low-risk activities, said it would concentrate on three core areas in 1997: financing equipment and providing financial services for local authorities, universal banking through Credit Communal de Belgique and Banque Internationale a Luxembourg, and asset management through the same subsidiaries.
